alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:24PM CDT until March 26 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... St. Francis River near Patterson affecting Wayne County. .Heavy rain will result in significant rises on the St. Francis River. The river is forecast to crest at Patterson tonight around 9 feet above flood stage. For the St. Francis River...including Patterson, Fisk...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Francis River near Patterson. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 23.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Friday was 23.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.5 feet on 01/30/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 1130 PM CDT.
